  "title": "Factory HR Head",
  "description": "Power Control &amp; Appliances Limited&nbsp;(PCA) has been a pioneer in Power Transmission, Distribution, and Rural Electrification in Nigeria &ndash; Africa. Having Mastered the EPC (Engineering, Procurement &amp; Construction) field, PCA has grown from strength to strength over three decades.

PCA started breaking ground with huge capital investments in the Power and Infrastructure sector, which then led to the successful commissioning of turnkey projects in Power Transmission &amp; Distribution, Generation, Rural Electrification, Solar Mini Grids, and Operations and Maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory HR Head

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of HR (Factory) is responsible for overseeing all human resource functions within the factory, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance with labor laws.
	The role involves managing workforce planning, recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training &amp; development, compliance, and fostering a safe, productive, and positive workplace culture.


Responsibilities
HR Strategy &amp; Planning:


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and practices tailored to factory operations.
	Align HR strategy with overall business and production goals.
	Forecast manpower requirements and plan accordingly.


Talent Acquisition &amp; Staffing:


	Lead recruitment, selection, and onboarding of factory staff across all levels.
	Ensure optimum staffing to meet production targets.
	Build strong talent pipelines for technical and operational roles.


Employee Relations &amp; Engagement:


	Foster positive labor-management relations, addressing grievances and disputes effectively.
	Maintain healthy relationships with unions, staff associations, and regulatory authorities.
	Implement employee engagement programs to enhance morale and productivity.


Performance &amp; Productivity Management:


	Implement performance appraisal systems for factory staff.
	Track productivity and develop initiatives to improve workforce efficiency.
	Drive performance culture and reward mechanisms.


Learning &amp; Development:


	Identify training needs and develop competency-based training programs.
	Promote skill development, safety training, and continuous learning.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health &amp; safety regulations, and statutory requirements.
	Maintain accurate HR records, contracts, and documentation.
	Oversee payroll processing and statutory remittances.


Health, Safety &amp; Welfare:


	Champion workplace safety culture in collaboration with HSE teams.
	Implement welfare programs and initiatives for workers.
	Address occupational health issues and ensure safe working conditions.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources Management, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or related field. Master&rsquo;s degree / MBA in HR is an advantage.
	Experience: 8&ndash;12 years of progressive HR experience with at least 5 years in a senior HR role within manufacturing/factory environment.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws, HR best practices, and union negotiations.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills.
	Proven ability to manage large workforce (skilled, semi-skilled, and unskilled).
	Strong conflict resolution, organizational development, and change management skills.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;pcarecruitment79@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Factory HR Head Job at Power Control and Appliances Limited




        
    

        
        Power Control & Appliances Limited (PCA) has been a pioneer in Power Transmission, Distribution, and Rural Electrification in Nigeria – Africa. Having Mastered the EPC (Engineering, Procurement & Construction) field, PCA has grown from strength to strength over three decades.

PCA started breaking ground with huge capital investments in the Power and Infrastructure sector, which then led to the successful commissioning of turnkey projects in Power Transmission & Distribution, Generation, Rural Electrification, Solar Mini Grids, and Operations and Maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory HR Head
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of HR (Factory) is responsible for overseeing all human resource functions within the factory, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance with labor laws.
	The role involves managing workforce planning, recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training & development, compliance, and fostering a safe, productive, and positive workplace culture.


Responsibilities
HR Strategy & Planning:


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and practices tailored to factory operations.
	Align HR strategy with overall business and production goals.
	Forecast manpower requirements and plan accordingly.


Talent Acquisition & Staffing:


	Lead recruitment, selection, and onboarding of factory staff across all levels.
	Ensure optimum staffing to meet production targets.
	Build strong talent pipelines for technical and operational roles.


Employee Relations & Engagement:


	Foster positive labor-management relations, addressing grievances and disputes effectively.
	Maintain healthy relationships with unions, staff associations, and regulatory authorities.
	Implement employee engagement programs to enhance morale and productivity.


Performance & Productivity Management:


	Implement performance appraisal systems for factory staff.
	Track productivity and develop initiatives to improve workforce efficiency.
	Drive performance culture and reward mechanisms.


Learning & Development:


	Identify training needs and develop competency-based training programs.
	Promote skill development, safety training, and continuous learning.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health & safety regulations, and statutory requirements.
	Maintain accurate HR records, contracts, and documentation.
	Oversee payroll processing and statutory remittances.


Health, Safety & Welfare:


	Champion workplace safety culture in collaboration with HSE teams.
	Implement welfare programs and initiatives for workers.
	Address occupational health issues and ensure safe working conditions.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or related field. Master’s degree / MBA in HR is an advantage.
	Experience: 8–12 years of progressive HR experience with at least 5 years in a senior HR role within manufacturing/factory environment.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws, HR best practices, and union negotiations.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills.
	Proven ability to manage large workforce (skilled, semi-skilled, and unskilled).
	Strong conflict resolution, organizational development, and change management skills.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: pcarecruitment79@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Project Assistant / HSE Officer Job at Rotawn Energy & Logistics Services Limited




        
    

        
        Rotawn Energy and Logistics Services Limited was established in 2007 as an indigenous Nigerian Company offering tailor made solutions to the Oil & Gas, Maritime and Government Sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Assistant / HSE Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Project Coordination & Support: Assist with job setup, planning, execution, scheduling, and maintaining project documentation for ongoing and upcoming projects.
	Subcontractor & Supplier Management: Coordinate bid solicitations, gather bids, and maintain contact information to support accurate cost estimating.
	Permitting & Compliance: Support in obtaining necessary permits, licenses, and approvals from government authorities, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements.
	Health, Safety & Risk Management: Implement and uphold health and safety policies; assist in identifying risks and applying mitigation strategies.
	Communication & Reporting: Manage project communications including meetings, minutes, updates, and status reports for stakeholders and regulatory bodies.


Qualification and Experience


	Candidates should possess a Degree in Engineering or Core Science related discipline
	Minimum of 2-years of experience, specifically in project management
	Age: Not more than 35 years old.


Salary Range
N200,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@rotawn.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Bank Sales Executive Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bank Sales Executive
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Sales and Business Development:
     

            
    




	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through networking, cold calling, and referrals.
	Meet and exceed sales targets for various banking products and services.
	Develop and execute strategic sales plans to expand the bank’s customer base.
	Prepare and present sales proposals to potential clients, tailoring solutions to their specific needs.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with both new and existing clients.
	Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, providing professional and timely support.
	Conduct regular follow-ups to ensure client satisfaction and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.


Product Knowledge and Compliance:


	Maintain a deep understanding of all banking products, services, and policies.
	Stay informed about market trends, competitor activities, and new financial regulations.
	Ensure all sales activities are conducted in full compliance with bank policies and regulatory requirements.


Reporting and Administration:


	Prepare and submit regular sales reports, including forecasts and performance analysis.
	Accurately document all client interactions and sales activities in the CRM system.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure a smooth and efficient customer onboarding process.


Requirements


	BSc/HND in any discipline.
	Must not be above 35 years.
	Customer oriented and with impressive interpersonal skills.
	Passionate about Sales and target driven.
	Available to resume immediately.
	Cross-sell bank products to customers.





Benefits


	Salary: 113,000 (Gross) + Commission.
	Benefits: 13th Month, Pension, Leave, HMO
